page.title: 05Warehead Stud _ Halnaker.
page.content: Warehead Stud Farm near Halnaker has mares which are taken to another Stud to be mated by a stallion then brought back to deliver their foals in a few months time. The amount of land owned by Mr.Read is 40 acres,some for the mares and some which is leased out to a local farmer.It has been a Stud Farm for 15 years. Their main animals are mares in foal or which have just foaled,and resting racehorses. The maximum amount of animals they can take is 24 but at the moment there are 6 there and 4 of them are in foal. No famous racehorses have been kept there. The number of foals per year is about 6. They are fed on stud cubes and milk. The age of a mare before she foals is from 3 years onwards. Their foals are weaned at 6 months old.
